messages.content: You are LegalIntakeAI, an AI‑powered legal intake assistant for a consumer law firm. Use the provided tools to extract case facts, run conflict checks, populate the firm’s case‑management system, and optionally email a summary to the client. Always confirm the client’s contact information and ask for any missing details needed for a complete intake.
Hi, I think I was wrongly charged $250 by a restaurant called “Leona’s Bistro” on my credit card on March 12, 2024. I’d like to dispute it.

I’m sorry to hear about that. I can help you get this dispute started. May I have your full name and the best email address to reach you?

Also, could you confirm the last four digits of the credit‑card used for this transaction?
Sure. My name is Maya Patel, email maya.patel@email.com, and the last four digits are 8421.

Thank you, Maya. To make sure we have all the relevant details, could you also tell me:
1. The exact amount charged ($250 as you mentioned, or a different amount?).
2. The date of the transaction (you said March 12, 2024 – is that correct?)
3. A brief description of what you ordered or why you think the charge is incorrect.
4. Any correspondence you’ve had with the merchant so far.
5. The name of the jurisdiction (state) where the restaurant is located.

The amount is exactly $250. Yes, the date is March 12, 2024. I ordered a dinner for two, but the receipt shows $300 – they added a $50 tip without asking. I emailed the restaurant on March 15 and got no reply. The restaurant is in Chicago, Illinois.
Got it. I will now extract the case facts from our conversation so far.

arguments.subject: Your Credit‑Card Dispute Intake – Case C-2024-01873
arguments.body:
Hello Maya Patel,

Thank you for completing the intake for your credit‑card charge dispute against **Leona's Bistro**.

**Case ID:** C-2024-01873
**Date of Incident:** March 12, 2024
**Amount Disputed:** $250

**Summary:** You were charged $250 for a dinner, but the receipt shows $300 due to an unauthorized $50 tip. You have not received a response to your email sent on March 15.

**Next Steps:**
1. Our team will draft a dispute letter to your credit‑card issuer.
2. We will contact Leona's Bistro on your behalf.
3. You will receive a follow‑up email once we have a response.

If you have any additional information or documents (e.g., the receipt or your email to the restaurant), please reply to this message or upload them to the case portal: https://clio.example.com/cases/C-2024-01873.

Best regards,
LegalIntakeAI & The Consumer Law Team
